Thanks.

So thinking about this I think back in 2015 or earlier when we first drafted the API there was a tag argument with the ctor... Later on, someone on the team noticed that the tag is not very useful (as it's chatty and a failed start can also be observed via a Finish) and we removed the tag but kept other parts of the API the same. There was discussion about whether to do a one shot with one API and one tag, but it was believed that the ReadInitialMetadata is a valid separate step and thus we kept it. A long time afterwards we introduced arena, factory and Prepare API which made things more blurry :)

I think this change should be ok but I am not sure whether any user is depending on the current behavior (<but why?>). I could not think of any but would like to be careful. Maybe send out an email to the mailing list first? I like it because of the perf benefit and I think we should push forward with the change.
Thanks for the feedback. What I'll do is merge it and then also post a note on grpc-io explaining the change.
